company.assemblylines

Class Assemblyline

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • company.assemblylines.Assemblyline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Observer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Line1, Line2, Line3

    public abstract class Assemblyline
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.util.Observer, java.lang.Cloneable
    An assemblyline has a list of workstations and can be advanced.

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentTime

        public Timestamp getCurrentTime()
        Returns the current time of this assembly line.

      • startNextDay

        public void startNextDay()
        Sets the current time of this assemblyline to the beginning of the next day.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this assemblyline is not empty.

      • getStatus

        public Assemblyline.Status getStatus()
        Returns the current status of this assembly line.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(Assemblyline.Status status,
             int time)
        Changes the status of this assemblyline to the given status.
        Parameters:
        status - the new status of the assemblyline.
        time - if the current status of this assemblyline is broken, this parameter represents the time (in minutes) that this assemblyline was broken. Otherwise this parameter will be ignored.

      • supports

        public boolean supports(Order order)
        Checks whether this assembly line accepts the given order or not.
        Returns:
        false if this assembly line does not contain the needed workstations for assembly of the given order or if the type of the given order appears in the ignore-list of this assemblyline. Otherwise returns true.

      • update

        public void update(java.util.Observable ws,
          java.lang.Object obj)
        This method is called whenever a carpart is installed in one of the workstations on this assemblyLine. The assemblyline will notify the schedule.
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        ws - this parameter will be ignored.
        obj - this parameter will be ignored.

      • advance

        public Order advance(Order next)
        advances the assembly line. Putting the given order on the first workstation and returning the order on the last workstation.
        Parameters:
        order - The order that will be put in the first workstation. May be null if no new order should be started this cycle.
        Returns:
        The order that was on the last workstation and is now finished, or null if no order was being assembled on the last workstation.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if not all workstations on this line are ready yet or if this assemblyline is currently broken.

      • isReadyToAdvance

        public boolean isReadyToAdvance()
        Method to check whether the assembly line can be advanced
        Returns:
        true if all workstations on this line are ready

      • getWorkstations

        public Workstation[] getWorkstations()
        Returns:
        The list of workstations this assemblyLine contains

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Method to check whether no workstation on the assembly line currently has an order
        Returns:
        true if no workstation on this assemblyline currently has an order.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • clone

        public Assemblyline clone()
        Returns a copy of this assemblyline. The workstations will be cloned as well and the observer-observable relation will be set for the clones. The clone of the assemblyline will not have observers.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
